Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Technology In Government

Items.Title: Oversight – Developments with New York City’s Compliance with The Help America Vote Act of 2002 and Security Issues Relating to the Selection of Permanent Voting Systems
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight – Developments with New York City’s Compliance with The Help America Vote Act of 2002 and Security Issues Relating to the Selection of Permanent Voting Systems

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Board of Elections to promptly certify Precinct Based Optical Scan voting systems that are compliant with the New York State Board of Elections voting system standards for procurement by the county Boards of Elections and urging the Board of Elections in the City of New York to select a Precinct Based Optical Scan system that is compliant with the New York State Board of Elections voting system standards as the new voting technology for the City of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Urging the NYS Board of Elections to promptly certify precinct based/optical scan voting systems.

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Technology In Government

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Brewer, James, Barron, Jackson, Sanders and DeBlasio.

Items.Title: Oversight – Developments with New York City’s Compliance with The Help America Vote Act of 2002 and Security Issues Relating to the Selection of Permanent Voting Systems
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Filed, by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight – Developments with New York City’s Compliance with The Help America Vote Act of 2002 and Security Issues Relating to the Selection of Permanent Voting Systems

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Board of Elections to promptly certify Precinct Based Optical Scan voting systems that are compliant with the New York State Board of Elections voting system standards for procurement by the county Boards of Elections and urging the Board of Elections in the City of New York to select a Precinct Based Optical Scan system that is compliant with the New York State Board of Elections voting system standards as the new voting technology for the City of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Urging the NYS Board of Elections to promptly certify precinct based/optical scan voting systems.
